Class Logo

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window

            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • interpreter.Logo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Logo
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This is starter code for CIT 594 Assignment 9. You can do anything you want with it (including ignore it entirely). If you keep more than a few lines, you should also keep my name as one of the authors.

    All comments should be brought up to date to correspond to your changes in the code.

    Version:
    April 15, 2014
    Author:
    David Matuszek, Joopyo Hong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • parse

        Tree<Token> parse()
        Parses the text in the programTextArea and returns it as a binary tree, or null if the text fails to parse. Either way, a message is put in the errorField.
        Returns:
        The resultant abstract syntax tree.

      • makeScrollable

        private static javax.swing.JScrollPane makeScrollable(java.awt.Component component,
                                     java.lang.String title)
        Embeds a GUI component inside a titled JScrollPane.
        Parameters:
        component - The Component to be titled and made scrollable.
        title - The title for the component.
        Returns:
        A scrollable, titled pane containing the given Component.

      • addTitledBorder

        private static void addTitledBorder(javax.swing.JComponent component,
                   java.lang.String title)
        Adds a titled border to the given Component. According to the Swing documentation, the setBorder(Border border) does not work well with all types of JComponents.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to which a titled forder is to be added.
        title - The text used for the title.

      • changeSpeed

        private void changeSpeed(int speed)
        Changes the speed at which the turtle draws, to correspond to the speed set by the speed control slider. A speed of zero means no movement, while the maximum speed available on the slider means that there is no delay between turtle actions.
        Parameters:
        speed -
